page.title: 11Social Concerns in Parbold
page.content: { }A committee was formed some years ago to find out from the residents how they wanted their village to look in the near future. The general view was that Parbold could be improved by the provision of more facilities but that it should remain basically a residential village. {Traffic:}Problems were noted about increased traffic to the M6 passing through the village and the increased potential for accidents.Parking within the village was causing concern, as the high car ownership put pressure on lack of space. {Pollution:}There is concern about smells from the sewage works, slurry spraying, and the Mill, with some improvement over recent years.Nuisance from dogs was noted, as was rubbish and half-submerged boats in the canal.
